column2: Document Title: ITP-214-CIV-HOP-Piling Pad (Supply and Install)
ITP Description: Piling Pad (Supply and Install)
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep TALASILA
Reference - Temporary Works Design - Crane Piling Pad Design
Acceptance Criteria - Material shall meet the requirements as per Temporary work design requirements
Verifying Documents - NATA Test –Material Test Report PSD,LL,PI,PL ,MMD & OMC
Acceptance Criteria - Survey to set out extent of crane piling pad requirements.
○ Survey pegs in place and clearly marks out the limits of works.
3.2 - Check location of underground and above ground utilities
○ Permits obtained from internal and external authorities
Acceptance Criteria - All foundations are to be free of water and loose material.
○ If the ground material on site does not meet the design assumptions, the Geotechnical Engineer shall be notified to determine if design change is required.
4.2 - Preparation of piling platform foundation (proof Roll)

Acceptance Criteria - Areas upon which fills are to be constructed, all layers of fill, shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173. Any unstable areas detected by test rolling shall be rectified. Nominated Authority to be present during all test rolling.
○ Temporary work Design Drawing and equipment design requirements. No waving indication.
Acceptance Criteria - Bearing Test to support piling rig (as indicated in temporary works design). Target 100kPa.
○ Testing and acceptance of compaction and moisture content as per VicRoads Cl 204.13
Verifying Documents - NATA Bearing Test Report, Compaction Test Results
Acceptance Criteria - Construction Tolerances finished ground level ± 40mm or equipment requirements

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
Document Title: ITP-215-CIV-HOP- Rail Delineation Fencing
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep TALASILA
1.2 - Hopkins FH01 Occupation Works Mark Up
1.4 - Rev 1, SAST-3281 Rev 1, and AS 1725 Chain link Fabric Fencing Security Fences and Gates
Acceptance Criteria - Delineation fence to be DB80 Concrete Barrier & Gawk Screens
Verifying Documents - Supplier Certificate of Compliance
Acceptance Criteria - Class 3 Crushed Rock to be installed for barrier foundation and crane piling pad
Verifying Documents - Supplier Certificate of Compliance
Acceptance Criteria - As per environmental controls
Acceptance Criteria - Survey to set out the following but not limited to: existing services, refuge bays and fence start and end points.
○ Offset checked against the running edge prior to installation of barriers.
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation completed by mechanical plant and hand tools.
○ Follow asset owners guidelines for work around their service.
Acceptance Criteria - All foundations are to be free of water and loose material.
○ If the ground material on site does not meet the design assumptions, the Geotechnical Engineer shall be notified to determine if design change is required.
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation of 300mm from ESL. Install Class 3 Crushed Rock as per set out requirements
○ The foundation shall have a minimum bearing capacity of 100kPa

Acceptance Criteria - Concrete barriers (DB80 F Shape) to be installed as per survey set out. - Installation to of fence to be 2.588m offset from outside edge of rail to the inside of the barrier. Barriers to be installed with 3x interconnected barriers between refuge bays (18m)
○ Install gawk screens compatible with concrete barriers.
Acceptance Criteria - No concrete barriers to be installed at locations of refuge bays.
○ Refuge bays to be 1200mm wide at intervals of 18m.
○ Install additional refuge bays or reduced spacing to allow access to rail assets
○ 50mm dia PVC pipe push out bars to be installed. PVC tubes to be pushed off from track side only.
○ Refuge bay signage installation halfway between each refuge bay
Acceptance Criteria - Limited clearance signs to be erected at all refuge locations and at each end of Delineation Fence
○ Sign to read "DANGER LIMITED CLEARANCE DO NOT OCCUPY DURING PASSAGE OF TRAINS"
Acceptance Criteria - Inside face of concrete barriers clearance from rail to be physically checked with tape measure.
○ All corners to be checked with Engineer and Foreman

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Tisala
Acceptance Criteria - Area has been set out in accordance with the drawings
○ ATTACH: LOT MARKED UP LOCATION ON THE IFC DRAWING (LOT MAP):
Frequency - Prior to commencement of excavation
5.1 - Inspection of Subgrade Material-Subgrade Material Properties

Acceptance Criteria - Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Nominated Authority and the Contractor shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material in accordance with Clause 204.04
○ In situ material within 400mm of cut floor level to be consistent with IFC Drawings
○ If parameters are met, rip and re compact to a depth of 150mm.
○ If assumed design parameters not met, remove 400mm of material and replace with conforming Type A fill.
○ If existing material needs to be removed and replaced with Type A Fill, ITP-CIV Type A Fill - Road is to be utilised.
Enter: Type A fill Lot Number:
Verifying Documents - This ITP/Test Report/Referenced Lot number
Acceptance Criteria - Material classified as silt, either before or after compaction, is not acceptable as Type A material without stablisation to the satisfaction of the Nominated Authority
Verifying Documents - Superintendent satisfied with Stabilisation, Signed ITP/ records
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of rock subgrade shall be presented to the Superintendent for acceptance.
○ Any necessary amendments to the subsurface drainage design including transverse subsurface drainage at the interfaces shall be presented to Superintendent for review.
Frequency - Prior construction of the regulating layer
Acceptance Criteria - Where Unsuitable material is encountered, proposed in-situ treatment must be submitted to the Nominated Authority for review.
Acceptance Criteria - Where groundwater is encountered the contractor shall notify the superintendent and submit proposed action for review.
○ The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater.

Acceptance Criteria - All pavement and verge areas at cut to fill zones shall be excavated to a minimum depth of 600mm below the cut floor level or top of the type A material, for a distance of not less than 15m into the cut and 30m under the fill from the cut-fill line at the upper surface of the Type A material.
Acceptance Criteria - Proof rolls to be conducted in accordance with Section 173 of the VicRoads Standard Specification
Acceptance Criteria - All Type A Material, Type B Material placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material and Ripped and re-compacted material below Cut Floor Level
Verifying Documents - Test Records, Lot Register
Reference - Vic Roada 204.04 Table 204.141 Section 204.14 a) or b)
Acceptance Criteria - Material Properties (Not Applicable for Scale C):
• 1 Lot Test to determine: Assigned CBR and swell, Grading & Max. Particle Dimension, PI and PIx%Passing 0.425mm and permeability.
• Where the first lot passes, no further testing required except where changes to the physical properties of the material are observed.
Verifying Documents - Sign ITP, Attach Material Property Test Report
Acceptance Criteria - The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point.
• Where Scale C is nominated, random levelling is not required; however no point on the subgrade surface shall be more than 10 mm above or 30 mm below the specified level.
Verifying Documents - Sign ITP, Attach Survey Report

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
Document Title: ITP-218-CIV-HOP- Type A Fill - Road (Supply and Install)
ITP Description: Type A Fill - Road (Supply and Install)
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Tisala
Reference - Section 204.04 b) Table 204.041 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Type A material shall comply with the requirements of Table 204.041 and shall be free of topsoil, deleterious and/or perishable matter.
Frequency - Once, for each material type
Verifying Documents - Supplier Material Conformance Certificate
Acceptance Criteria - Areas upon which fills are to be constructed shall be prepared for test rolling by the Contractor.
○ The Contractor shall not commence placing any fill on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Nominated Authority.
○ No fill shall be placed against or within 3 m of a structure until the foundation for the fill has been reviewed by the Nominated Authority
Frequency - Prior to commencement of fill works
Acceptance Criteria - Set out pegs in place and clearly mark out limits of works.
○ ATTACH: LOT MARKED UP LOCATION ON THE IFC DRAWING (LOT MAP)
Frequency - Each lot prior to commencement
Verifying Documents - Signed ITP, Lot Map
Acceptance Criteria - Type A material shall be spread and compacted in layers not exceeding a compacted thickness of 200 mm.
Acceptance Criteria - Each Layer shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173. Where site access is restricted, verify with a pickaxe drop or similar, at the Nominated Authorities discretion.
Acceptance Criteria - Testing as per 204. Ensure testing is tracked and reports available.
• For work to be tested for compliance with Scale A or Scale B compaction requirements, the number of tests per test lot shall be six.
• For work to be tested for compliance with Scale C compaction requirements, the number of tests per test lot shall be three.
○ Lot size - the leser of one day's production or 5,000sqm
Frequency - Test the first 3 lots. Reduced min. frequency every 2nd lot of like material and work
Verifying Documents - Sign ITP, Attach Compaction Test Report

Acceptance Criteria - The top of the Type A material, Cut Floor Level and subgrade surfaces shall be prepared to level and shape within the tolerances specified in Clause 204.03 (g) to produce a smooth, hard, tightly bound surface, free from depressions capable of holding water).
Reference - Table 204,041, Table 204.141 Section 204.14 a) or b)
Acceptance Criteria - Material Properties (Not Applicable for Scale C):
• 1 Lot Test to determine: Assigned CBR and swell, Grading & Max. Particle Dimension, PI and PIx%Passing 0.425mm and permeability.
• Where the first lot passes, no further testing required except where changes to the physical properties of the material are observed.
Verifying Documents - Sign ITP, Attach Material Property Test Report
Acceptance Criteria - The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point.
• Where Scale C is nominated, random levelling is not required; however no point on the subgrade surface shall be more than 10 mm above or 30 mm below the specified level.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Survey Conformance Report
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed in CAMs.
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
Document Title: ITP-219-CIV-HOP-Type B Fill - Road (Supply and Install)
ITP Description: Type B Fill - Road (Supply and Install)
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Reference - General Notes on IFC Section 204.4 c), 204.06 e)

Acceptance Criteria - Free of topsoil, deleterious &/or perishable matter and maximum particle size ≤ 150mm. Swell < 2.5%. CBR >2%. Material classified as expansive or silt, either before or after compaction, shall not be used as Type B.
Acceptance Criteria - Set out pegs in place and clearly mark out limits of works.
Frequency - Each lot prior to commencement
Acceptance Criteria - Areas upon which fills are to be constructed shall be prepared for test rolling by the Contractor.
○ The Contractor shall not commence placing any fill on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
Frequency - Prior to commencement of fill works
Acceptance Criteria - Type B material shall be spread and compacted in layers not exceeding a compacted thickness of 200 mm unless dispensation granted by superintendent.
Acceptance Criteria - Each layer of fill shall be keyed into the layer above by creation of a textured surface.
Acceptance Criteria - All layers of fill and cut floor level to be test rolled in accordance with section 173.
Acceptance Criteria - All Type A Material, Type B Material placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material and Ripped and re-compacted material below Cut Floor Level
Frequency - Initially test every lot until three consecutive achieve passing results. If achieved, minimum frequency of testing from Table 204.142:
○ Placed within 400 mm of top of Type B: Test every second lot of like material and work
○ Placed more than 400 mm below top of Type B material: Test every third lot of like material and work

Acceptance Criteria - The top of the Type B material, Cut Floor Level and subgrade surfaces shall be prepared to level and shape within the tolerances specified in Clause 204.03 (g) to produce a smooth, hard, tightly bound surface, free from depressions capable of holding water).
Acceptance Criteria - Surface is not to be more than 15mm or less than 30mm from what is specified in IFC drawings
○ The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point.
• Min. No. of Measurements Per Lot: 40
• Tolerance: mean value of readings +5mm to -25mm and Maximum Standard Deviation to be 15mm
Frequency - Each lot (Random level assessments of the surface shall be undertaken in lots not exceeding 4000 m2)
Verifying Documents - Survey Conformance As Built

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
